verses.text: 大衛有意為耶和華建殿那時，王住在自己的宮中，耶和華使他安享太平，不受周圍仇敵的侵擾。

words.note: Short for '第一代志上', First Book of Chronicles.

verses.text: 王對拿單先知說：「你看！我自己住在香柏木的宮裡，耶和華的約櫃卻停在帳幕內。」
拿單對王說：「你可以照著你心所想的一切去作，因為耶和華與你同在。」
拿單把 神的話傳給大衛那天晚上，耶和華的話臨到拿單說：

words.note: Indicates the following noun is directly affected by the verb.

verses.text: 「你去對我的僕人大衛說：耶和華這樣說：『你要建造一座殿宇給我居住嗎？
因為自從我把以色列人從埃及帶上來的那天起，直到今日，我都沒有住過殿宇。我一直都住在帳棚和會幕裡，到處漂泊。

words.note: Suffix indicating starting point in time.
Refers to a grand building, like a temple or royal palace.
Refers to the portable sanctuary used by Israelites before the Temple.
Describes a life of moving without a fixed home.

verses.text: 我與以色列眾人一起走過的地方，我可曾對以色列的一個支派的官長，就是我所吩咐要牧養我子民以色列的，說：你們為甚麼不給我建造一座香柏木的殿宇呢？』

words.note: A rhetorical question particle, implying 'did I ever?'
Used for the tribes of Israel.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.
Often used in a spiritual sense of caring for a flock or people.
Refers to a nation's people, especially in a sacred or historical context.
Refers to a grand building, like a temple or royal palace.

verses.text: 現在你要對我的僕人大衛這樣說：『萬軍之耶和華這樣說：我把你從牧場中、從照顧羊群的工作中揀選出來，使你作我子民以色列的領袖，

words.note: In biblical context, often refers to a servant of God.
A title for God emphasizing his sovereignty over armies/multitudes.
Directional complement indicating movement outwards.
Refers to a nation's people, especially in a sacred or historical context.

verses.text: 你無論到哪裡去，我都與你同在；我必在你面前剪除你所有的仇敵。我要使你得享大名，像世上那些偉人的名一樣。

words.note: Often used to express divine presence or companionship.

verses.text: 我要為我的子民以色列選定一個地方，不再受騷擾；惡人也不能再像以前那樣苦待他們，

words.note: Refers to a nation's people, especially in a sacred or historical context.

verses.text: 像我立了士師治理我的子民以色列的那天以來那樣。我要使你安享太平，不受你所有的仇敵侵擾。耶和華向你宣告，耶和華要親自為你建立一個朝代。

words.note: Refers to the leaders in the Book of Judges.
An idiomatic phrase meaning to enjoy peace and tranquility.

verses.text: 到了你的壽數滿足，你與你的列祖一起長眠的時候，我必興起你親生的後裔接替你，並且我要堅固他的國。

words.note: Refers to the number of one's days, i.e., life.
A euphemism for death, meaning to sleep forever.

verses.text: 他必為我的名建造一座殿宇，我要永遠堅固他的國位。

words.note: Often used in biblical context as 'for the sake of my name'.

verses.text: 我要作他的父親，他要作我的兒子，他若是犯了罪，我要用人的刑杖、用世人的鞭子糾正他。

words.note: Here implies 'of ordinary men' or 'human ways'.

verses.text: 但我的慈愛必不離開他，像離開在你面前的掃羅一樣。
你的家和你的王國，也必在我（按照《馬索拉文本》，「我」作「你」；現參照其他抄本及古譯本翻譯）的面前永遠堅定，你的王位也必永遠堅立。』」
拿單按著這一切話，又照著全部的默示，都對大衛說了。

words.note: Refers to divine revelation or inspiration.

verses.text: 大衛的禱告與稱頌於是，大衛王進去，坐在耶和華面前，說：「主耶和華啊！我是誰，我的家又算甚麼，你竟帶領我到這地步？

words.note: Abbreviation for 歷代志上 (Lìdài Zhì Shàng).
A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Refers to a stage or degree of development.

verses.text: 主耶和華啊，這在你眼中還看為小事，你也說到你僕人的家未來的事。主耶和華啊，這豈是人常遇到的事嗎？

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
眼+中 (yǎnzhōng) forms 'in your eyes'.
Commonly refers to a servant of God in religious texts.
A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Used for rhetorical questions, implying the opposite.

verses.text: 主耶和華啊，你認識你的僕人，大衛還有甚麼話可以對你說呢？

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Commonly refers to a servant of God in religious texts.

verses.text: 你因自己應許的緣故，又按照自己的心意，行了這大事，為要使你僕人明白。

words.note: Commonly means 'promise' in biblical context.

verses.text: 主耶和華啊，因此，你是偉大的！按照我們耳朵所聽見的，沒有像你的，除了你以外，再沒有別的 神。

words.note: A title for God or Jesus.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
見 here acts as a verb complement indicating successful perception.

verses.text: 世上有哪一個國家像你的子民以色列呢？ 神曾親自救贖他們，使他們作自己的子民，又為他自己立名，為他們（按照《馬索拉文本》，「他們」作「你們」；現參照其他抄本及古譯本翻譯）作了大事，為你的地作了可畏的事；在你的子民面前，就是你從埃及救贖出來歸你自己的子民面前，趕出了列國的人和他們的神。

words.note: Refers to a nation or group of people as 'children' of a ruler or God.

words.definition: make a name, establish a reputation

words.note: A collection of Jewish texts of the Hebrew Bible.
Formal equivalent of 和 (hé).
Literally 'can be feared', implies awe and reverence.
出 is a verb complement indicating direction 'out'.
Often used in biblical contexts to mean 'all nations' or 'the nations'.

verses.text: 你為自己堅立了你的子民以色列，使他們永遠作你的子民；耶和華啊，你也作了他們的 神。

words.note: Means to establish or set up something in a steadfast manner.

verses.text: 耶和華 神啊！你所應許關於你僕人和他的家的話，現在求你永遠堅守，並且照著你所說的去行吧；

words.note: Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
Commonly means 'promise' in biblical context.
Means to adhere steadfastly to a principle or promise.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
Indicates proceeding to an action.

verses.text: 這樣，你的名必永遠為大，以致人要說：『萬軍之耶和華是以色列的 神。』你僕人大衛的家也必在你面前得堅立。

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: Refers to heavenly hosts or armies of God.
Classical Chinese possessive, similar to 'de'.
The Hebrew personal name for God.
Capitalized when referring to the one true God.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華以色列的 神啊！因為你曾啟示你的僕人說：『我要為你建立家室。』所以你的僕人才敢來向你作這樣的禱告。

words.note: Refers to heavenly hosts or armies of God.
Classical Chinese possessive, similar to 'de'.
The Hebrew personal name for God.
Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
Refers to a royal house or lineage in this context.
Can also function as a verb 'to pray'.

verses.text: 主耶和華啊！你是 神；你的話是真實可信的。你向你僕人應許了這美好的福分。

words.note: A title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
The Hebrew personal name for God.
Capitalized when referring to the one true God.

verses.text: 現在求你樂意賜福給你僕人的家，使它在你面前可以永遠存在。主耶和華啊！因為你曾經這樣應許，願你僕人的家因你的賜福永遠蒙福。」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
The Hebrew personal name for God.
